com.nokia.places.request

Class Modifier

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nokia.places.request.Modifier

  • public abstract class Modifier
extends java.lang.Object
    This class allows a user to modify the responses provided by the requests to the RESTful places service.

    The Places library allows applications to adjust the presentation of the returned response to suit their needs.

    Applications can activate the various tailoring options by passing a series of options as additional query string parameters to the request.

    Note: Representation modifiers are resource-specific and therefore are not propagated to links in the response which point to a different resource type. This means that applications need to add representation modifiers to all links received in a response except for those that link to the same resource type e.g. the URI in the next attribute.

    • Method Detail

      • setPageSize

        public void setPageSize(int size)
        This method sets the page size.The option defines the page size (maximum number of items) of all paginatible collections in the response; if not provided, each collection may define its own reasonable default. Individual collections may define a maximum page size and then use that instead of the provided value. For example:

        In search results, the size option determines the maximum amount of result items to show on each result list page (default: 20). In media collections such as media.images, the maximum number of images to return (default: 5).

        Parameters:
        size - the page size to set

      • getPageSize

        public int getPageSize()
        This method retrieves the maximum number of items to be retrieved by this request.
        Returns:
        The maximum page size for this request.

      • setTextFormat

        public void setTextFormat(java.lang.String textFormat)
        This method sets the text format. Various attributes returned in responses are defined as rich text strings. With this option, clients can define the format in which rich text attributes are exposed. Supported values are:

        • html : (default) The rich text is rendered as an XHTML fragment using a subset of the standard HTML elements applicable for text rendering, including a, b, br, ul, ol, li, i, p, h? or img (only used for inline-images).
        • plain : The rich text attribute is reduced to a plain text representation.
        Parameters:
        textFormat - the text format to set.

      • getTextFormat

        public java.lang.String getTextFormat()
        This method retrieves the preferred RichTextFormatting style
        Returns:
        either PLAIN or HTML formatting style

      • addImageDimensions

        public void addImageDimensions(java.lang.Integer width,
                      java.lang.Integer height)
        This method is used to allow applications to request a specific maximum size of images to match their UI and bandwidth requirements. When a resource provides a URI of image resources (e.g. photos of a place), applications are able to request specific maximum sizes of those images to match their UI and bandwidth requirements.

        The format is that of a comma-separated list where each element specifies dimensions for a scaled image by providing either the desired width, desired height, or both. Valid elements are:

        w \d+ h\d+ w\d+-h\d+

        Examples:

        • image_dimensions=w32-h32,w64-h64
        • image_dimensions=w32-h32,w300
        • image_dimensions=h200

        The provided values are used as upper boundaries for the dimensions of the returned images. The solution never scales up small images and maintains the aspect ratio of the original image.

        If this option is used, the Image objects in a ImagePage contain a dimensions attribute, which is a map containing links to the sized variants of the original image.

        Parameters:
        width - preferred image width ( or null if width not specified)
        height - preferred image height ( or null if height not specified)

      • setOffset

        public void setOffset(java.lang.Integer offset)
        This method sets the result offset to modify to the base URL.
        Parameters:
        offset - the offset value.

      • getAdditionalModifiers

        public java.util.Hashtable getAdditionalModifiers()
        This method retrieves the specified set of arbitrary additional custom modifiers to add to the URL request.
        Returns:
        A set of modifiers consisting of a table of Strings forming key value pairs.

      • setAdditionalModifiers

        public void setAdditionalModifiers(java.util.Hashtable additionalModifiers)
        This method adds a set of arbitrary additional custom modifiers to add to the URL request.
        Parameters:
        additionalModifiers - a table of Strings forming key value pairs.
